meanings.definition: A person who tends cattle on a ranch
meanings.sent1: The cowpokes guided the cattle back to the barn.
meanings.sent2: The ranch had a team of skilled cowpokes to care for the animals.
meanings.sent3: The cowpokes told jokes to the cows to keep them entertained.
meanings.sent4: The cowpokes were the unsung heroes of the ranch, working tirelessly under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cowpokes riding into the sunset stayed with him forever.

meanings.definition: To prod or urge someone or something with a stick or finger
meanings.sent1: She gently cowpokes the dough to check its consistency.
meanings.sent2: He cowpokes the firewood to keep the flames alive.
meanings.sent3: The child cowpokes the cat's tail, making it twitch in annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The coach cowpokes the players to give their best performance on the field.
meanings.sent5: The teacher cowpokes the students to think critically and ask questions.
